item.title: Introduction
item.description: Welcome to the guide to proper vocal technique. These tips will help both your speaking and singing voice, as singing should just be an extension of your regular voice.

item.title: What's our goal?
item.description: You probably opened this guide with a simple goal: “learn how to sing (better)”. But what does that mean?

item.title: How the voice works
item.description: This is a more technical part of the guide. But I wanted to start with it so I can refer back to it in all subsequent chapters.

item.title: Breathing
item.description: In chapter 2, I talked about this “tension” that many people build before they sing a note. Breathing is usually the culprit.

item.title: Relaxing
item.description: This is probably the longest and most important chapter. Because all the issues and bad habits mentioned so far … come from tension, from not being relaxed.

item.title: Vocal Onset
item.description: Okay, where are we now? We’ve learned how to start our sounds properly, by breathing and being relaxed while doing it.

item.title: Articulation
item.description: At the start, I mentioned that your jaw and tongue are probably the biggest (but often unnoticed) culprits. But doing specific exercises for these muscles is usually boring or vague.

item.title: Vocal Placement
item.description: Okay, let’s recap. You start your notes well. You breathe in using your abdomen, you’ve done exercises so your face is relaxed, you have a nice vocal onset and a tongue that is out of the way.

item.title: Voice Types & Ranges
item.description: So far, we’ve discussed general exercises that should help anybody relax and prepare their voice. (For both speaking and singing.

item.title: Pitch & Scales
item.description: Maybe you noticed that I haven’t give you any information or exercises on pitch yet. This is quite unexpected for a course on singing and speaking—and we’re already at chapter 10!

item.title: Vibrato & Timbre
item.description: This guide has taught you all about singing with good breath support, without tension, and—not to forget—the right pitches.

item.title: Vocal Damage
item.description: This final chapter of the guide talks about vocal damage. About how to take care of your fragile voice, through lifestyle, food, and other health-related habits.

item.title: Conclusion
item.description: Well done! You’ve finished the guide on proper vocal technique! Here I just want to recap all you’ve learned.
